Node.definition: with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong and so find relief from their anger
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong and so find relief from their anger
literally: to shine (forth); hence: = process by which a deity appears accompanied by a bright shining light

Node.gloss: to lift up oneself = to come into action
Node.definition: literally: to lift oneself up; hence: = action by which deities come in action after a time of inactivity

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to repay|to pay back|to punish|to reward
Node.definition: literally: to send back (to someone); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities case (other) humans or deities to receive the appropriate return for their actions, which can be either good or bad
= action by which humans or deities deal with other humans of deities according to their actions, which could be either by punishing them or by giving them a reward
= state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

Node.gloss: (to cause) to bubble up > to pour out
Node.definition: literally: to cause to bubble up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter many words

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= words spoken in arrogance
= action by which humans utter words about themselves, usually with the purpose of drawing all attention to themselves
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
literally: to crush; hence: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to suffer harm and humiliation, ◄ which feels as if one has been crushed with a heavy object
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

= state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor
= causative action by which humans take the life of other humans, whether or not intentionally

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= short form of יהוה (יהוה) only found in poetic texts

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to be dull|to be stupid|to be coarse|to be brutish
Node.definition: = state in which someone lacks intelligence, refinement and culture

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: to judge; hence: = action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= short form of יהוה (יהוה) only found in poetic texts
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to possess particular knowledge
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing
= causative action by which deities cause humans to feel confident and calm
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= action by which humans break up and move earth or stone, usually with a tool, and with the purpose of creating a hole
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to return|to come back|to happen again
Node.definition: literally: to come back; hence: = process by which a certain event happens once more
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is committed to follow Y's leadership and example
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to act wickedly|to do wickedness|to do evil
Node.definition: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: to take position; hence: = action by which humans stand firm without fear in the face of danger
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= marker indicating that if the event in focus would not have been true another event would not haven taken place
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
= location characterized by the absence of any sound or noise; ≈ a metaphor for the realm of death

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which the mind of humans is filled with distressing thoughts

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to make an alliance with someone else
Node.definition: = action by which one party makes an agreement with another party to do something together
the throne representing someone's position as monarch or judge
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life
literally: to form; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause a certain pattern of events to take place, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= a pattern of behavior required by somebody in authority
= action by which several people form a group in order to pursue a common goal together

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
literally: blood; hence: = living human being, ◄ defined by the blood flowing through their veins
= state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: (God as a) stronghold|(God as a) refuge
Node.definition: = a reference to God characterizing him as someone who provides security
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
figurative extension of a rock as place of refuge: = deity that protects and provides refuge
= person in whom one has put one's trust; ◄ because of difficult circumstances; ► in order to find protection or safety

Node.gloss: to repay|to pay back|to punish|to reward
Node.definition: literally: to send back (to someone); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities case (other) humans or deities to receive the appropriate return for their actions, which can be either good or bad

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering

Node.gloss: to destroy|to wipe out|to annihilate|to silence|to consume
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events remove (other) humans from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, sickness, strong emotions, or (possibly) direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

Node.gloss: to destroy|to wipe out|to annihilate|to silence|to consume
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events remove (other) humans from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, sickness, strong emotions, or (possibly) direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
